image.altText: Person holding shopping bags, legs only

props.synopsis: While it's clear many thrifty shoppers saw the need to hunt for Christmas gift bargains in November, the Australian Bureau of Statistics notes that overall spending has been subdued.

title.children: A pull-back in Australians' spending habits is concerning economists

image.altText: Man sitting at a desk wearing a dark blue polo shirt.

props.synopsis: Australian cryptocurrency entrepreneur Sam Lee has been charged over a $US1.89 billion fraud scheme alongside two others.

title.children: Australian Sam Lee charged over billion-dollar cryptocurrency fraud scheme in US

image.altText: A close up of Imran Khan looking down and gesturing with his hands near a Pakistan flag.

props.synopsis: Mr Khan's PTI political party said it would challenge the decision and called the case against Mr Khan a "sham".

title.children: Former Pakistani PM Imran Khan handed 10-year jail sentence for leaking state secrets

image.altText: Celeste Manno smiles happily in a selfie.

props.synopsis: Violent killer Luay Sako exaggerated mental illness to avoid facing trial for murder a psychiatrist has told Victoria's Supreme Court.

title.children: Obsessed killer Luay Sako faked illness to get 'sympathy' after murdering woman, court hears

image.altText: A bride and groom in front of a pink and purple floral arrangement.

props.synopsis: Almost 2.5 million viewers tuned in for the season 11 debut of Married at First Sight — and for those not watching other stations, reality TV was still a popular choice.

title.children: Why 'reality at 7:30' has become a ratings winner for Australian TV

image.altText: A composite image shows Georgie Purcell in two photos which appear identical except for changes to her clothing.

props.synopsis: Animal Justice Party's Georgie Purcell has responded after Channel Nine apologised for using a digitally altered image of the MP during a broadcast on its news coverage last night.

title.children: 'It should never happen again': Victorian MP responds to Nine's apology for digitally altered image

image.altText: Joseph Wu, Taiwan Foreign Minister, wearing a navy suit and blue tie with the Taiwan flag behind him.

props.synopsis: Taiwan's foreign minister has rejected Beijing's warning that the election of Taiwanese President William Lai would jeopardise the status quo between China and Taiwan.

title.children: Taiwan's foreign minister warns conflict with China in Taiwan Strait would damage the world

image.altText: Three men push a car out of floodwater

props.synopsis: Several people are rescued in the Moreton Bay suburb of Bray Park as some streets are flooded and waist-deep water sweeps through homes.

title.children: Multiple swiftwater rescues as rising floodwaters catch people off guard in Queensland

image.altText: A boat with police written across it and police tape along a wharf stopping anyone getting too close

props.synopsis: Four people, including two 17-year-olds, are arrested after a man drowns during what police say was an attempt to steal a woman's handbag at Hobart's waterfront overnight.

title.children: Man drowns after alleged robbery attempt, with four arrested in Hobart's north

image.altText: A man with a white shirt and red collar lifts a bowling ball with a vaccum. He's in a red circle with Godfreys underneath.

props.synopsis: Vacuum cleaner retailer Godfreys has entered voluntary administration, leaving 193 jobs on the line with 54 stores to close in the next 14 days as it undergoes a restructure while searching for a buyer.

title.children: Vacuum cleaner retail chain Godfreys collapses, 193 job losses expected in coming fortnight

image.altText: papua new guinea and chinese flags flown in front of a ship

props.synopsis: The Coalition is trying to ramp up pressure on the federal government over new police cooperation negotiations between China and Papua New Guinea, saying it's "essential" that Australia's strategic position in the Pacific nation isn't undermined.

title.children: Opposition needles government after revelations PNG and China discussing police cooperation

image.altText: A composite image of Tony Abbott.

props.synopsis: Dozens of Tony Abbott's Coalition colleagues reveal why they think his prime ministership unravelled so quickly.

title.children: 'A hideous day of embarrassment': For Tony Abbott's colleagues, one political debacle still makes them cringe

image.altText: A young man with light brown hair smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: South Australian seafood company heir Marcus Cappo has been confronted by three moving victim impact statements, after he pleaded guilty to a slew of child exploitation offences.

title.children: Teenage victims confront groomer Marcus Cappo who leaked explicit images

image.altText: Exterior Veolia waste facility.

props.synopsis: Residents living near a Veolia waste management site in northern Tasmania are told to stay indoors and shut their homes to air from outside due to "deteriorating" drums containing chemicals.

title.children: Residents told to stay indoors during hazardous material incident at Veolia near Devonport

image.altText: Paramedics carry a woman on a stetcher

props.synopsis: Questions are being raised on the safety of swimming in Sydney Harbour after a woman was attacked by a bull shark on Monday evening. Calls to stay out of the water have been made by local councillors, but what do experts say?

title.children: Shark expert weighs in on whether it is safe to swim in Sydney Harbour after woman's leg mauled

image.altText: A map of Newcastle to Sydney train line. The nose of a bullet train.

props.synopsis: Advocates welcome $80 million in federal funding for a high-speed rail business case, but say with the project still many years away, upgrades to the existing line must also be prioritised.

title.children: Funding flows for high-speed rail between Sydney and Newcastle, but scepticism on timeline remains

image.altText: A lock wrapped around a green gate next to a security notice, behind red brick wall with Williyama High School with logo.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of students and staff from a regional public high school will be relocated for the beginning of Term 1 next week due to mould detection in multiple buildings.

title.children: Mould outbreak at high school forces indefinite closure days before start of new school year

image.altText: Dutton stands at a lectern speaking, a poster with CME logos behind him.

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says he would end funding to the Environmental Defenders Office if the Coalition wins government at the next federal election, accusing the group of engaging in unethical "lawfare" that frustrates mining and energy projects.

title.children: Dutton pledges to scrap funding for Environmental Defenders Office

image.altText: People being carried on a donkey with smoke plumes in the distance

props.synopsis: The army identified the main target of the hospital raid as a member of the Islamist militant movement, with the other two being from a local group of gunmen.

title.children: Israel's military says it 'neutralised' Hamas militants hiding in West Bank hospital

image.altText: Kurtley Beale outside court wearing a shirt and tie

props.synopsis: A recorded phone call between rugby player Kurtley Beale and the woman who alleges he sexually assaulted her at a Bondi pub in 2022 is played in court.

title.children: 'I feel bad, I'm so sorry': Phone call between Wallabies star and sexual assault accuser played in court

image.altText: A hand reaches to pat a small light pink pig.

props.synopsis: There are cat cafes, where lattes take second place to the animals, and now in Japan, customers can cuddle up with pigs while having a cuppa.

title.children: At trendy Japanese cafes, customers enjoy cuddling with pigs

image.altText: Ben Simmons puts his hand in the air and smirks during an NBA game for the Brooklyn Nets.

props.synopsis: After almost three months out with a back injury, Australian Ben Simmons says he is as happy as he has been at any point in his NBA career as he makes his return with the Brooklyn Nets.

title.children: Ben Simmons gets back on court in NBA return alongside 'a bunch of friends'

image.altText: A mural painted in graffiti style on a wall.

props.synopsis: An Indigenous teenager died in 2022 after an unmarked police car collided with a motorbike he was riding in Sydney's inner-south.

title.children: Coroner refers death of teenager who collided with a police car for potential criminal charges

image.altText: Daniela and Aleksandra Vergulis, in separate images, smile at the camera. Daniela wears sparking earrings and a necklace.

props.synopsis: Vasilis Vergulis is identified as the man who allegedly murdered his wife and shot his daughter at their home in Adelaide's north-east last July, after a court lifts a suppression order.

title.children: Adelaide man pleads not guilty over alleged shooting of wife and daughter

image.altText: Spiral galaxy NGC 2835 blue core with vibrant orange arms

props.synopsis: One month into the new year and the James Webb Space Telescope is offering scientists fresh insights on star formation, galactic structure and evolution through a series of images.

title.children: Super telescope images reveal 'mind-blowing' new details of galaxies

image.altText: A South African batter drives on the off-side against Australia in a women's T20 international.

props.synopsis: Alyssa Healy's Australia are keen to seal their T20I series in Hobart, but can South Africa stun the hosts like they did at Manuka Oval to clinch an overall win? Follow our live ScoreCentre.

title.children: T20 live: Series up for grabs as Australian women take on South Africa in Hobart decider

image.altText: Police forensic officers standing next to white vehicles.

props.synopsis: Bailey Jordan Lester was under the influence of methamphetamine and GHB when he stabbed a man to death in a suburban home last year.

title.children: Perth court hears details of 'frenzied' attack in which one man was killed, two others injured

image.altText: A composite image of a large penguin on a beach

props.synopsis: Amazed birdwatchers believe a young king penguin that approached them on a Coorong beach may never have seen a human before, with the species normally staying in Antarctica and on sub-Antarctic islands.

title.children: King penguin turns up on SA beach thousands of kilometres from Antarctic home
